abstract.p: Dan Rodman letter on Denmark's windmill project (Oct 9 article) observes that once again we see how other countries are way ahead of United States in renewable energy

block.p: Once again we see how other countries, like Denmark, are way ahead of the United States on renewable energy (''In This Energy Project, No Tilting at Windmills,'' Samso Journal, Oct. 9). Instead of financially possible and globally responsible projects like windmills and reduction of car dependency, too many of our tax dollars are squandered on environmentally damaging subsidies (forest clear-cutting, oil and gas tax breaks) and wasteful military spending, some of which the military didn't even request!

Once again we see how other countries, like Denmark, are way ahead of the United States on renewable energy (''In This Energy Project, No Tilting at Windmills,'' Samso Journal, Oct. 9). Instead of financially possible and globally responsible projects like windmills and reduction of car dependency, too many of our tax dollars are squandered on environmentally damaging subsidies (forest clear-cutting, oil and gas tax breaks) and wasteful military spending, some of which the military didn't even request!
It is time for our politicians to invest in the ''national security'' we have marginalized for too long: renewable energy.
